top.title: Trump vows 'very strong action' if Iran executes protesters
top.summary: Relatives of an arrested protester tell BBC Persian he is due to be executed on Wednesday, as the death toll from demonstrations reportedly exceeds 2,400.

top.title: At least 32 killed after crane collapses on train in Thailand
top.summary: Sixty-four people were left injured, including a one-year-old and an 85-year-old.

top.title: Greenlanders brace for summit that could shape the Arctic's future - and their own
top.summary: US Vice President JD Vance will host Danish and Greenlandic foreign ministers for talks on Wednesday.

top.title: No 10 welcomes reports X is addressing Grok deepfakes
top.summary: The use of the AI tool to digitally undress women has sparked a backlash as well as intervention from the government and regulator.

top.title: Honey, I shrunk the data centres: Is small the new big?
top.summary: Huge data centres are being built to handle AI computing but some experts say they aren't necessary.

top.title: Monzo bank says issue affecting its mobile app resolved
top.summary: A Monzo spokesperson said it had activated a back-up banking service after identifying issues affecting its app.

title.#text: The Atlantic, Penske, and Vox Media have all sued Google for antitrust violations
X hasn’t really stopped Grok AI from undressing women in the UK
